noun.description: A strong-smelling underground fungus that resembles an irregular, rough-skinned potato, growing chiefly in broadleaved woodland on calcareous soils. It is considered a culinary delicacy and found, especially in France, with the aid of trained dogs or pigs.
A soft candy made of a chocolate mixture, typically flavored with rum and covered with cocoa.

origin: Late 16th century: probably via Dutch from obsolete French truffle, perhaps based on Latin tubera, plural of tuber hump, swelling. truffle (sense 2) dates from the 1920s.
